discourse_list.title: If you are not going to reduce stability fee, then lower the overcollateralization percentage

content.content: “Oh no hes putting the maintaining of the peg first over burning more MKR to increase our holdings! How dare he actually care about the real purpose of the project! Doesn’t he know we create as little new MKR as possible and burn off as much as possible? Then we simple sell our bags and walk off as the peg shits itself.” I am completely new to crypto and MakerDao, but it sure didn’t take very long to figure out the scam going on behind these shitcoins.
content.GPT-summary: The post is a negative feedback on a proposal related to MakerDao. The author is criticizing the proposal and expressing their disappointment with the project. The post also includes a statement about the author's perception of the project as a scam.

content.content: Which vaults do you feel have too high of a stability fee, or have too high of a collateralization requirement?
I feel that the stability fee of ETH is a bit low, it should be SF>3%.

nanook:  I am completely new to crypto and MakerDao, but it sure didn’t take very long to figure out the scam going on behind these shitcoins.   As you mentioned, you are quite new to this. Maybe spend some time to understand why various parameters are set the way they are before accusing people of scamming. Regarding stability fee. We had them all set to zero for some time, it has very little effect on the peg in comparison to 2-4% and it has a huge downside (that we cannot start to decentralize the protocol because there is no money available to pay anyone to do anything.) You can find some background on that decision here. If you feel Maker and DAI are shitcoins and don’t want to take the time to understand why parameters are set the way they are then please find another group of people to annoy.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely negative feedback on proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
